final_answer.precision_note: Answer given to 3 significant figures, consistent with the precision of current (1.50 A), time (30.0 min), Faraday constant (96500 C mol-1), and Cu atomic mass (63.55).

method: First convert time to seconds: 30.0 min x 60 = 1800 s. Calculate charge using Q = It: Q = 1.50 A x 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons using n(e-) = Q/F: n(e-) = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons produce 1 mole of Cu, so n(Cu) = n(e-)/2 = 0.02798/2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass: mass = n x Ar = 0.01399 mol x 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
checks: Charge Q = 1.50 A x 1800 s = 2700 C, divided by F = 96500 C mol-1 gives 0.02798 mol electrons.
The 2:1 ratio of electrons to Cu gives n(Cu) = 0.01399 mol, and mass = 0.01399 x 63.55 = 0.889 g.
